faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about PrismGB

questions.question: What devices are supported?
questions.answer: PrismGB is designed exclusively for the Mod Retro Chromatic handheld gaming device. Other devices are not currently supported.

questions.question: Do I need to install drivers?
questions.answer: Windows and macOS work out of the box. On Linux you may need one quick USB package - see the GitHub page for the short setup steps.

questions.question: What are the system requirements?
questions.answer: Works on Windows 10+, macOS 10.15+, or modern Linux (Ubuntu 18.04+, Fedora, Arch) with a USB port for your Chromatic.

questions.question: What are the render presets?
questions.answer: Pick from five looks: True Color (original GBC feel), Vibrant (brighter), Hi-Def (sharper edges), Vintage (CRT-style scanlines), and Pixel (LCD grid overlay).

questions.question: Where are my screenshots and recordings saved?
questions.answer: Captures save to your regular Videos or Pictures folder with clear timestamps so you can find them later.

questions.question: My Chromatic isn't detected. What should I do?
questions.answer: Make sure your Chromatic is powered on, then try a different USB port or cable. If it still doesn't show up, restart PrismGB and plug it back in.

questions.question: The video stream is laggy or choppy. How can I fix it?
questions.answer: Switch to a lighter visual style in settings. If it still feels off, restart the app or reconnect your Chromatic.

questions.question: Recording fails or produces no output. What's wrong?
questions.answer: Check that you have enough disk space. Close other apps that might be using your camera or microphone, then try again.
